ygData.subject: Wandering in the Grasslands
ygData.msgSnippet: Teltoli sighed as she plodded through the grasslands. The battle had been hard, and not being able to deal with wars between the factions any more, she had

Subject: Wandering in the Grasslands

In-Reply-To: <976921955.34923@egroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0

Content-Length: 2431
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: steph_teltoli@...

Teltoli sighed as she plodded through the grasslands. The battle had 
been hard, and not being able to deal with wars between the factions 
any more, she had given up and become Neutral. It was so much easier 
than constant war!

She actually felt pretty good, despite the fact she ran away. Ah 
heck, she'd see them again, she'd help them, but when the final 
battle cane, she didn't want to be part of it.

Her mind screamed at her that she was a coward. Her Father - a great 
Warrior - would be dissapointed in her. Her mother would be proud of 
her. Mother always wanted her to be a Healer, she always was one to 
go go with The Way of the Leaf. To live ones appointed time, and to 
not resist when its their time to die. If they are attacked, you run, 
but you don't defend yourself, because to hurt something is bad to 
the soul. 

Teltoli's face screwed up in contempt. She couldn't remember the 
times that she had argued with her Mother over that point.

And so, here she was in this hot savannah, trying to seek out her old 
friend Carnage. She missed her terribly, and she wanted to apolgize 
for just vanishing like that last time. Hopefully she could stay a 
while longer this time!

Carnage had been the first bot that Teltoli had met when she had come 
out the pod. First meetings were slightly scary, especially when the 
first bot was a large raptor that looked like she could tear a bot to 
shreds on a whim. But they had gotten to know each other, travelled 
together, and a friendship grew that couldn't be replaced, or at 
least in her mind. 

She shook a bug off her nose, and it flew off, twirling to the ground 
in it's vain attempt to get its wings to work. The yellow grass was a 
plain contrast against her silver and black coat, and it messed up 
her fur, annoyingly. A panther wasn't meant for this sort of 
environment, and her wings that were lying flat across her back only 
served to heat her up more. Her wings! Teltoli rolled her eyes and 
flapped her hawk wings, flying into the sky and putting her two front 
legs out to steady herself. 

"Whoohoo!" Her cry echoed over the gassy plains, she loved flying, 
and it was so much easier than walking. It made her feel free, to be 
one with the sky, the very esscense of life and all the joys that 
came with it. Free among the birds.

Realizing what she was meant to be doing, she turned her optics to 
the ground and hummed a tune as she scanned.
